results.title: Around the clock
results.creator_credit: David Morgan, John Richardson, Department of Postmaster-General and Kestrel Films & Video (Australia)
results.brief_description: There are approximately 5,500 official and unofficial post offices under the auspices of Australia Post. The film shows various aspects of the work done by Australia Post, moving mail by land, air, and sea. No credits available.

results.title: Around a gum tree
results.creator_credit: David Bilcock, Geoffrey Bell, Owen Brothers Animated Films and Shell Oil Company
results.brief_description: Shows examples of Australia’s many varieties of gum trees growing in their natural surroundings. The way people live in the different types of country is described in addition to the main story of the gum trees themselves.

results.title: Aroha
results.brief_description: Through the story of Aroha, daughter of a Maori chieftan, we see how the Maori people of New Zealand are integrating their ancient tribal customs with the ways of their non-Maori neighbours and progressing toward a fuller equality as citizens of New Zealand. Aroha, a student of Wellington University, is able to bring her people to a greater acceptance of the non-Maori’s ways when her father is brought back to health in a modern hospital. Depicts Maori customs and concludes with tribal dances. No other credits available.

results.title: Arnold
results.creator_credit: Ron Headford and Ron Headford Productions
results.brief_description: Shows the familiar orators on the banks of the Yarra on a typical Sunday afternoon in Melbourne. Using still photographs, plus an actual sound recording of the orator and the interjections of the crowd, it provides an interesting glimpse of the orator and the people who gather round him. Photographer: Barrie Bell.

results.title: Army ordnance
results.brief_description: Describes the functions of Ordnance in the Australian Army; how it supplies ammunition, transport, clothing, etc. Explains how equipment is manufactured by private firms and is thoroughly checked by Ordnance men before being sent to depots for storage. Shows the procedure for dealing with an order from receipt to final despatch.

results.title: Aristotle and the scientific method
results.brief_description: An analysis of Aristotle’s contribution to the development of scientific method. Departing from Plato’s ideas, Aristotle made observations based on his experience, classified his data, performed experiments and sought to arrive at generalizations or principles. Also examines how his work laid the foundation for such sciences as botany and zoology. No other credits available.

results.title: Ariel II
results.brief_description: Deals with the history of the second international satellite and how it was developed and placed into orbit by American and British scientists in an effort to gain new knowledge about the structure of the universe. It covers research, experiments and development in Britain and assembly, testing and launching in the U.S. Produced for N.A.S.A. No other credits available.

results.title: Are you positive?
results.creator_credit: Eric Porter, Ed Cullen and Artransa Park Studios
results.brief_description: Describes and refutes various common misconceptions about tuberculosis. Shows how erroneous beliefs have arisen and analysis of the mistaken ideas that tuberculosis is no longer a serious disease; that it is easy to control with drugs; that long periods in hospital are not necessary; that it does not affect old people; that people who feel fit cannot be infected. The simple precautions of chest X-ray and skin tests are explained.

results.title: Are you listening?
results.brief_description: Observes the operation of the Development Music Programme, adapted by Deanna Hoermann form the Kodaly method, in New South Wales, where children are being trained to be musically literate. Results show improvements in mathematics, reading, memory, concentration and other learning skills.Classroom activities in kindergarten and primary grades show the techniques and concepts used. Suitable for Upper Secondary and Tertiary students.

results.title: Are we really doing well?
results.brief_description: Examines the services provided by the management consultant company Inter-Firm Comparison Service and their different approaches to helping small business proprietors in the areas of efficiency, profitability, flexibility and industrial and public relations. No other credits available.
